page.title: 10REDCAR TARN.
page.content: Redcar Tarn,or as it is more commonly known,Keighley Tarn is situated on Redcar Lane between Steeton and Keighley. Formerly the tarn was used for boating as there was a boathouse,which has now been demolished,a jetty and a place where canoes were moulded.This has been proved since the rediscovery of three concrete canoe moulds which were built by a Mr. F.Taylor of Keighley in the 1920's. The first canoe mould was discovered by a Keighley Artist,Stanley Boardman in late 1972.The following year pupils from South Craven School,Cross Hills and teacher Mr.A.Rye searched for the remaining two moulds during the four days of the school Project Week.
